CatDescriptText: Mr. Edward A. Walton, postal clerk, Homewood and Mr. James Glascoe, custodial worker, North Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 17, 1962, pg. 7 with question: "What's wrong with the Republican party in Allegheny County?" Mr. Edward A. Walton's answer reads: "For one thing, they don't seem to be as aggressive as the Democrats are getting out the vote.  The Democrats have a strong hold on the city, but in my opinion, it doesn't have to be if the Republicans just put forth a little more effort."  Mr. James Glacoe's answer reads: "I don't know because the Democrats seemingly have everything.  And I'm satisfied with the Democrats and the main reason is because I have a job under them."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Edward A. Walton wearing light colored trench coat and hat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of James Glascoe wearing plaid coat and cap, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
